g1401.definition: [δοῦλος] from {{g1210}}; a slave (literal or figurative, involuntary or voluntary; frequently, therefore in a qualified sense of subjection or subserviency)

g1403.definition: [δοχή] from {{g1209}}; a reception, i.e. convivial entertainment

g1404.definition: [δράκων] probably from an alternate form of δέρκομαι (to look); a fabulous kind of serpent (perhaps as supposed to fascinate)

g1405.definition: [δράσσομαι] perhaps akin to the base of {{g1404}} (through the idea of capturing); to grasp, i.e. (figuratively) entrap

g1406.definition: [δραχμή] from {{g1405}}; a drachma or (silver) coin (as handled)

g1407.definition: [δρέπανον] from δρέπω (to pluck); a gathering hook (especially for harvesting)

g1408.definition: [δρόμος] from the alternate of {{g5143}}; a race, i.e. (figuratively) career

g1409.definition: [Δρούσιλλα] a feminine diminutive of Drusus (a Roman name); Drusilla, a member of the Herodian family

g1410.definition: [δύναμαι] of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible

g1411.definition: [δύναμις] from {{g1410}}; force (literally or figuratively); specially, miraculous power (usually by implication, a miracle itself)

g1415.definition: [δυνατός] from {{g1410}}; powerful or capable (literally or figuratively); neuter possible

g1416.definition: [δύνω]   or δῦμιprolonged forms of an obsolete primary      δύο (to sink); to go "down"

g1418.definition: [δυσ-] a primary inseparable particle of uncertain derivation; used only in composition as a prefix; hard, i.e. with difficulty

g1419.definition: [δυσβάστακτος] from {{g1418}} and a derivative of {{g941}}; oppressive

g1420.definition: [δυσεντερία] from {{g1418}} and a comparative of {{g1787}} (meaning a bowel); a "dysentery"

g1421.definition: [δυσερμήνευτος] from {{g1418}} and a presumed derivative of {{g2059}}; difficult of explanation

g1422.definition: [δύσκολος] from {{g1418}} and κόλον (food); properly, fastidious about eating (peevish), i.e. (genitive case) impracticable

g1424.definition: [δυσμή] from {{g1416}}; the sun-set, i.e. (by implication) the western region

g1425.definition: [δυσνόητος] from {{g1418}} and a derivative of {{g3539}}; difficult of perception

g1426.definition: [δυσφημία] from a compound of {{g1418}} and {{g5345}}; defamation

g1427.definition: [δώδεκα] from {{g1417}} and {{g1176}}; two and ten, i.e. a dozen

g1429.definition: [δωδεκάφυλον] from {{g1427}} and {{g5443}}; the commonwealth of Israel

g1430.definition: [δῶμα] from δέμω (to build); properly, an edifice, i.e. (specially) a roof

g1432.definition: [δωρεάν] accusative case of {{g1431}} as adverb; gratuitously (literally or figuratively)

g1433.definition: [δωρέομαι] middle voice from {{g1435}}; to bestow gratuitously

g1436.definition: [ἔα] apparent imperative of {{g1439}}; properly, let it be, i.e. (as interjection) aha!

g1437.definition: [ἐάν] from {{g1487}} and {{g302}}; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.; often used in connection with other particles to denote indefiniteness or uncertainty See {{g3361}}.

g1438.definition: [ἑαυτοῦ] from a reflexive pronoun otherwise obsolete and the genitive case (dative case or accusative case) of {{g846}}; him- (her-, it-, them-, also (in conjunction with the personal pronoun of the other persons) my-, thy-, our-, your-) self (selves), etc.

g1439.definition: [ἐάω] of uncertain affinity; to let be, i.e. permit or leave alone See also {{g1436}}.

g1440.definition: [ἑβδομήκοντα] from {{g1442}} and a modified form of {{g1176}}; seventy

g1443.definition: [Ἐβέρ] of Hebrew origin ({{h5677}}); Eber, a patriarch

g1444.definition: [Ἑβραϊκός] from {{g1443}}; Hebraic or the Jewish language

g1445.definition: [Ἑβραῖος] from {{g1443}}; a Hebræan (i.e. Hebrew) or Jew

g1446.definition: [Ἑβραΐς] from {{g1443}}; the Hebraistic (Hebrew) or Jewish (Chaldee) language

g1447.definition: [Ἑβραϊστί] adverb from {{g1446}}; Hebraistically or in the Jewish (Chaldee) language

g1448.definition: [ἐγγίζω] from {{g1451}}; to make near, i.e. (reflexively) approach

g1450.definition: [ἔγγυος] from {{g1722}} and γυῖον (a limb); pledged (as if articulated by a member), i.e. a bondsman

g1451.definition: [ἐγγύς] from a primary verb ἄγχω (to squeeze or throttle; akin to the base of {{g43}}); near (literally or figuratively, of place or time)

g1452.definition: [ἐγγύτερον] neuter of the comparative of {{g1451}}; nearer

g1453.definition: [ἐγείρω] probably akin to the base of {{g58}} (through the idea of collecting one's faculties); to waken (transitively or intransitively), i.e. rouse (literally, from sleep, from sitting or lying, from disease, from death; or figuratively, from obscurity, inactivity, ruins, nonexistence)

g1455.definition: [ἐγκάθετος] from {{g1722}} and a derivative of {{g2524}}; subinduced, i.e. surreptitiously suborned as a lier-in-wait

g1456.definition: [ἐγκαίνια] neuter plural of a presumed compound from {{g1722}} and {{g2537}}; innovatives, i.e. (specially) renewal (of religious services after the Antiochian interruption)

g1458.definition: [ἐγκαλέω] from {{g1722}} and {{g2564}}; to call in (as a debt or demand), i.e. bring to account (charge, criminate, etc.)

g1459.definition: [ἐγκαταλείπω] from {{g1722}} and {{g2641}}; to leave behind in some place, i.e. (in a good sense) let remain over, or (in a bad sense) to desert

g1460.definition: [ἐγκατοικέω] from {{g1722}} and {{g2730}}; to settle down in a place, i.e. reside

g1461.definition: [ἐγκεντρίζω] from {{g1722}} and a derivative of {{g2759}}; to prick in, i.e. ingraft

g1462.definition: [ἔγκλημα] from {{g1458}}; an accusation, i.e. offence alleged

g1463.definition: [ἐγκομβόομαι] middle voice from {{g1722}} and κομβόω (to gird); to engirdle oneself (for labor), i.e. figuratively (the apron as being a badge of servitude) to wear (in token of mutual deference)

g1465.definition: [ἐγκόπτω] from {{g1722}} and {{g2875}}; to cut into, i.e. (figuratively) impede, detain

g1467.definition: [ἐγκρατεύομαι] middle voice from {{g1468}}; to exercise self-restraint (in diet and chastity)

g1468.definition: [ἐγκρατής] from {{g1722}} and {{g2904}}; strong in a thing (masterful), i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) self-controlled (in appetite, etc.)

g1469.definition: [ἐγκρίνω] from {{g1722}} and {{g2919}}; to judge in, i.e. count among

g1470.definition: [ἐγκρύπτω] from {{g1722}} and {{g2928}}; to conceal in, i.e. incorporate with

g1471.definition: [ἔγκυος] from {{g1722}} and the base of {{g2949}}; swelling inside, i.e. pregnant

g1472.definition: [ἐγχρίω] from {{g1722}} and {{g5548}}; to rub in (oil), i.e. besmear

g1473.definition: [ἐγώ] a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic) For the other cases and the plural see {{g1691}}, {{g1698}}, {{g1700}}, {{g2248}}, {{g2249}}, {{g2254}}, {{g2257}}, etc.

g1475.definition: [ἔδαφος] from the base of {{g1476}}; a basis (bottom), i.e. the soil

g1476.definition: [ἑδραῖος] from a derivative of ἕζομαι (to sit); sedentary, i.e. (by implication) immovable

g1477.definition: [ἑδραίωμα] from a derivative of {{g1476}}; a support, i.e. (figuratively) basis

g1478.definition: [Ἐζεκίας] of Hebrew origin ({{h2396}}); Ezekias (i.e. Hezekeiah), an Israelite

g1479.definition: [ἐθελοθρησκεία] from {{g2309}} and {{g2356}}; voluntary (arbitrary and unwarranted) piety, i.e. sanctimony

g1480.definition: [ἐθίζω] from {{g1485}}; to accustom, i.e. (neuter passive participle) customary

g1481.definition: [ἐθνάρχης] from {{g1484}} and {{g746}}; the governor (not king) of a district

g1484.definition: [ἔθνος] probably from {{g1486}}; a race (as of the same habit), i.e. a tribe; specially, a foreign (non-Jewish) one (usually, by implication, pagan)

g1485.definition: [ἔθος] from {{g1486}}; a usage (prescribed by habit or law)

g1486.definition: [ἔθω] a primary verb; to be used (by habit or conventionality); neuter perfect participle usage

g1487.definition: [εἰ] a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in {{g1489}}, {{g1490}}, {{g1499}}, {{g1508}}, {{g1509}}, {{g1512}}, {{g1513}}, {{g1536}}, {{g1537}}. See also {{g1437}}.

g1488.definition: [εἶ] second person singular present of {{g1510}}; thou art

g1489.definition: [εἴγε] from {{g1487}} and {{g1065}}; if indeed, seeing that, unless, (with negative) otherwise

g1490.definition: [εἰ δὲ μή(γε)] from {{g1487}}, {{g1161}}, and {{g3361}} (sometimes with {{g1065}} added); but if not

g1491.definition: [εἶδος] from {{g1492}}; a view, i.e. form (literally or figuratively)

g1492.definition: [εἴδω] a primary verb; used only in certain past tenses, the others being borrowed from the equivalent {{g3700}} and {{g3708}}; properly, to see (literally or figuratively); by implication, (in the perfect tense only) to know Compare {{g3700}}.

g1493.definition: [εἰδωλεῖον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g1497}}; an image-fane

g1494.definition: [εἰδωλόθυτον] neuter of a compound of {{g1497}} and a presumed derivative of {{g2380}}; an image-sacrifice, i.e. part of an idolatrous offering

g1496.definition: [εἰδωλολάτρης] from {{g1497}} and the base of {{g3000}}; an image- (servant or) worshipper (literally or figuratively)

g1497.definition: [εἴδωλον] from {{g1491}}; an image (i.e. for worship); by implication, a heathen god, or (plural) the worship of such

g1498.definition: [εἴην] optative (i.e. English subjunctive) present of {{g1510}} (including the other person); might (could, would, or should) be

g1499.definition: [εἰ καί] from {{g1487}} and {{g2532}}; if also (or even)

g1500.definition: [εἰκῆ] probably from {{g1502}} (through the idea of failure); idly, i.e. without reason (or effect)
